When a sound is recorded in a computer file, it is to be stored as a series of 8-bit encoded data. When the same sound source is sampled at the same sampling frequency and then encoded as a series of 16-bit data in lieu of 8-bit data, which of the following is an appropriate description concerning this encoding?

options.text: The amplitude of the sound can be recorded more finely.
When the recording time is the same, the amount of data becomes smaller.
The CPU load required to process the recorded data decreases.
The upper limit of the frequency that can be recorded becomes higher.

question.text: There is a program that displays text in accordance with the specifications below. When the original text described below is displayed, in what point size does the program display the underlined character string? Here, the first character of the original text is displayed in 10 points. [Specifications] The characters between and are displayed one point larger than the preceding character. The characters between and are displayed one point smaller than the preceding character. Each of and must be used as a pair, and both of them can be nested with each other. [Original text] The system administrator promotes and implements department-level or group-level computerization from a user’s standpoint.
(Question text for Q6 missing in sources)
(Question text for Q7 missing in sources)
(Question text for Q8 missing in sources)
(Question text for Q9 missing in sources)
Which of the following is the most appropriate description concerning a multi-core processor?

options.text: Several microprocessors are installed in one PC with the purpose of improving the reliability of the processing results by performing the same processing at the same time in each processor.
If the structure and clock frequency of the arithmetic logical unit are the same, a quad core processor has four times as much processing power as a dual core processor.

question.text: (Question text for Q11 missing in sources)
Which of the following is the appropriate technical term that describes an arithmetic logical unit that is used instead of a CPU to accelerate processing such as image processing for 3D graphics?

options.text: It is a frequency signal that synchronizes the arithmetic processing of CPUs.
It is a storage unit that is placed between a CPU and a main memory...
It is an arithmetic logical unit that is used instead of a CPU to accelerate processing such as image processing for 3D graphics.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning CPU performance?

options.text: Compared with a 64-bit CPU, a 32-bit CPU is able to process a longer data at one (1) time.

question.text: When the processing speed of the system overall is constrained because of slow processing speed in one of the components, which of the following is a term for the component that is causing the problem?
Which of the following is an appropriate characteristic of a dual system?

options.text: It provides two (2) sets of systems that perform the same processing and checks the correctness of the processing by comparing the results. If one of the systems fails, it isolates the failed system and continues the processing.
The same two (2) devices are used, so that the processing capability can be increased to double that of a simplex system.

question.text: (Question text for Q16 missing in sources)
Which of the following is a purpose of the virtual memory system that is one of the functions provided by an OS?

options.text: To prevent an application program from accessing the protected area on main memory used by the OS
To reduce electricity consumption during the idle state, by stopping the power supply after data is written from main memory to external storage
To make it possible to execute a program even if the program requires more storage capacity than main memory
To accelerate CPU processing with the assistance of a higher speed storage device than main memory

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate explanation of the virtualization of a server?

options.text: It is a technique for virtually creating computer-generated worlds or immersive environments that users can interact with.
It is a technique for virtually operating the GUI of a remote computer connected via a network by using a local computer.
It is a technique for virtually implementing and operating two or more computers on a single computer.
It is a technique for virtually allocating more memory space than the capacity of main memory by using a particular part of auxiliary storage.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate combination of the terms and explanations A through D concerning the file system of a hierarchical directory structure? A: It is the directory at the topmost level of the hierarchy. B: It shows all paths starting from the topmost directory of the hierarchy down to the target file or directory according to the directory structure. C: It is the directory that is currently being manipulated. D: It shows all paths starting from the directory that is currently manipulated through the target file or directory according to the directory structure. [Current directory, Absolute path, Root directory]

options.text: A (Root directory) B (Absolute path) C (Current directory)
A (Root directory) D (Relative path) C (Current directory)
C (Current directory) B (Absolute path) A (Root directory)
C (Current directory) D (Relative path) A (Root directory)

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning the use of OSS (Open Source Software)?

options.text: OSS users have an obligation to pay the developer the fee for the software.
OSS users are allowed neither to sell the OSS nor to distribute it at no fee.
OSS cannot be used in the field of genetic research.
Software derived from the published OSS can be made available as OSS.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate explanation concerning a deadlock?

options.text: It is a state in which the processes of a computer are prohibited from getting intentional or accidental access to information that usually must not be accessed.
It is a state in which, if the authentication of a user fails more than the limited number of times, the user is prohibited from accessing the computer.
It is a state in which, when shared resources are exclusively used, two or more processes are endlessly waiting for each other to release the lock of a shared resource.
It is a state in which processes in the ready state under a multi-programming environment have used up the CPU time allocated by the OS.

question.text: There is a system where a full backup is made after closing time every Sunday, and an incremental backup is made after closing time on Monday through Saturday. On a Wednesday, a failure happened during business hours, so a decision was made to restore data to the state at the time of closing on Tuesday by using backup files. Which of the following lists all the necessary backup files for restoring data? Here, an incremental backup file means a backup file that contains only the data that has been modified since the previous backup file (a full backup file or an incremental backup file) was made.

options.text: A full backup file on Sunday, incremental backup files on Monday and Tuesday
A full backup file on Sunday, an incremental backup file on Tuesday
Incremental backup files on Monday and Tuesday
An incremental backup file on Tuesday

question.text: If data is repeatedly added to and deleted from a hard disk on a PC, data may not be stored in consecutive areas on the hard disk. When no measures are taken, which of the following can occur?

options.text: Stored data cannot be read quickly.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate concept of universal design?

options.text: Ensuring that, once a product is designed, the design remains usable without being changed for a long period of time
Ensuring that products keep the same levels of performance and quality regardless of where they are manufactured in the world
Making the design as simple and easy as possible in order to reduce the manufacturing cost
Making products usable to many people regardless of differences in age, culture, and ability as well as whether disability is present

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning the characteristics of (Multimedia topic missing)?
(Question text for Q26 missing in sources)
In a relational database, which of the following is an appropriate description concerning a foreign key?

options.text: A foreign key must also be a primary key.
A foreign key may take a null value.
Multiple foreign keys can be defined in a single table.
Multiple fields cannot be collectively set as a single foreign key.

question.text: The result of the Information-Technology Engineers Examination by some of the employees of a company is shown below. In order to manage this table with a relational database, which of the following is an appropriate method to partition the table into two (2) tables?
question.images: Implied table data for Employee/Examination records

options.text: Employee_ID, Employee_name, Date_of_birth; and Employee_ID, Examination_category, Examination_date, Pass_or_fail

Among the authentication methods I through III, which of the following is the appropriate combination of methods and categories? I Personal Identification Number II Digital Certificate III Fingerprint [Authentication based on one’s memory, Authentication based on one’s possession, Authentication based on physical characteristics]

options.text: Authentication based on one’s possession; Authentication based on one’s memory; Authentication based on physical characteristics
Authentication based on one’s possession; Authentication based on physical characteristics; Authentication based on one’s memory
Authentication based on one’s memory; Authentication based on one’s possession; Authentication based on physical characteristics
Authentication based on one’s memory; Authentication based on physical characteristics; Authentication based on one’s possession

question.text: Which of the following is appropriate as the characteristic of single sign-on?

options.text: It is an effective countermeasure for information leakage because data is processed and stored on a server side, and data does not remain on devices.

question.text: Among the descriptions A through D concerning how to conduct information security education to employees, which of the following contains all and only the appropriate descriptions? A The re-education of one who has committed an information security breach includes preventive actions to avoid the same fault being repeated again. B One way to conduct it is to incorporate it in a training program for new employees. C It is restricted to employees in the information systems department. D It is conducted after an incident or an accident concerning information security as well as on a regular basis.

When information security measures are grouped into three (3) categories of technical security measures, human security measures, and physical security measures, which of the following is an appropriate example of physical security measures?

options.text: Making a non-disclosure agreement with employees
Attaching a digital signature to an e-mail when it is sent
Storing a notebook PC in a place that can be locked
Recommending password change on a regular basis

question.text: (Question text for Q40 missing in sources)
(Question text for Q41 missing in sources)
Which of the following is a term for software that encrypts files on a computer in order to make them unusable, and demands money or other valuables in exchange for the decryption key?
Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning password management?

options.text: A password that is used for a business system should not be used for any private Internet services.
The initial password should not be changed until a user becomes familiar with the operation of login to the system.
Several passwords should be prepared and used in rotation.
A password should be stored in a plaintext file and saved on a PC.

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning a scheme for authenticating a user of a system?

options.text: A scheme where authentication is accomplished by utilizing a password that can be used only once is called a single sign-on.
A scheme where the use of multiple servers or applications is authorized by being authenticated once is called a one time password.
A scheme where a sequence of numbers or characters that are placed on positions that the user remembers within a table on the screen is entered as a password is called a matrix authentication.
A scheme where authentication of the user is accomplished by using fingerprints, voiceprint, or other physical characteristics is called a challenge-response authentication.

question.text: When information is classified and managed according to the protection level in information security, which of the following lists all and only the appropriate methods (Missing methods list)?
question.images: Implied methods list (e.g., encryption, access control)

question.text: A system migration plan was created for the migration from an existing system to a new system. Which of the following is an appropriate item to be described in the system migration plan?

options.text: Schedule for parallel operation of the old and new systems
Evaluation criteria for the quality of the deliverables
The work history of project members

question.text: Mr. A, a participant in system testing, has no access to the internal structure of the system or software and prepares input data and output data to be used in verification of the transaction functions commonly used in the department. Which of the following is the testing technique that Mr. A is going to implement?
(Question text for Q48 missing in sources)

options.text: The party to which development is outsourced uses the software under the same conditions as the actual production environment in order to determine if it runs correctly.
A system test plan is created, and a test environment is prepared.
The functions and performance required of the system are clarified.
A program is created and test results are reviewed according to the evaluation criteria.

question.text: Which of the following corresponds to software maintenance? (Scenario: A system user requested a function addition because a required function was not included in the original requirements.)

options.text: A response time that was measured in a system test did not satisfy the requirement, so tuning was performed on the software.
(Implied answer related to corrective or adaptive changes after operation)

question.text: A system required rework due to missing functions requested by the system user. For the purpose of preventing such rework, which of the following is the method that is used to create trial models in an early stage and clarify user requirements?

Among the following lists of descriptions A through D, which is the set that contains all appropriate descriptions concerning quality management in information systems? A: Continuous initiatives according to the PDCA cycle are effective in improving quality. B: The more functions a system has, the higher the quality. C: The cost of preventing defects is generally less than the cost of correcting them when they are found. D: Quality can be increased through appropriate design and implementation.
After the start of a project, the scope is defined by collecting the requirements for the project. Which of the following is the most appropriate purpose of defining the scope?

options.text: To clarify the activities to be implemented in the project
To create the action plan against the risk that has been realized in the project
To create an action plan for the delay of the project
To create the objectives of the project

question.text: When the system development activities are implemented, a plan is set up to complete the activities in 20 days by six (6) members having the same productivity. However, the plan is changed to have the activities finished in 15 days, and new members are added. When the productivity of the new members is half of the initially planned members, what is the minimum number of new members necessary for finishing the activities in 15 days?

The response measure for risks in a project can be classified as avoidance, mitigation, acceptance, and transfer. In a system development project, the design and development process is to be subcontracted to Company A. In a previous system development, Company A suffered a delay for delivery, so it is also possible that a delay will occur in this project. Which of the following is a response measure that corresponds to mitigation of the risk of a delay?

options.text: The inclusion of causal analysis of the previous delay at Company A, and preventive measures on the basis of this analysis into the development plan
Cancellation of subcontracting to Company A
Inclusion in the contract of the term of the compensation for damages by Company A in the event of a delay
Inclusion in the project of the cost of measures in response to a delay

question.text: In a project where 60 programs are created with a budget of 18 million yen, when the status of the project was checked 20 days after the start of the project, it was found that 40 out of the 60 programs have been completed at a cost of 15 million yen. If the project continues to proceed at the same pace, what is the excess of cost over budget? Here, the scale of all programs and productivity are the same.
When the management of a project is divided into progress management, quality management, and cost management, which of the following is most appropriate to be (Missing activity description)?

Which of the following describes the activity that breaks down project deliverables and activities, and organizes them in a hierarchical structure, as well as clarifying the work units to be managed in the project?
Which of the following is an appropriate explanation of facility management?

options.text: It refers to the monitoring of compliance with SLAs and their periodical reviewing, for the purpose of maintaining and managing IT service levels.
It refers to a method for optimizing ownership, operation, maintenance, etc. of buildings and physical IT infrastructures from a business standpoint.
It refers to the continuous improvement of business processes to increase the quality of products and services.

It refers to sharing and managing information across the departments and the companies that participate in the series of processes from component procurement to manufacturing, distribution, and sales.

question.text: In release management of IT service management, the items which have been planned and approved according to the change management are implemented in the production environment. Which of the following is an appropriate description concerning release management?

options.text: Information may be provided after the completion of release to users and operation managers concerned with changes.
During release planning, cases when activities cannot be completed within the planned time period are also taken into account.
Since there is no possibility of new failures after release, it is not necessary to make preparations.
Regardless of the scale of release, the release is implemented simultaneously for all users.

question.text: Which of the following is the most appropriate explanation of what a service desk (Missing text)?

options.text: Receiving and recording inquiries from users

(Question text for Q62 missing in sources)
Which of the following is the most appropriate concept concerning the IT system implementation plan for improving the competitiveness of a company?

As a result of the systems audit requested by the management of a company, some problems are found in the effectiveness of the current information systems. Who are the most appropriate persons to whom the systems auditor gives advice and makes recommendations?
Which of the following is an appropriate measure to implement internal controls function?

options.text: Avoiding creating a job description indicating the scope of work and roles
Avoiding creating a work handover document for a successor
Avoiding processing purchasing and payment by the same person
Avoiding separating team members for system development and system operation

question.text: A person wishes to start at point X, pass through all of points A, B, and C, and arrive at point Y. When the routes and the required times between points are as shown in the figure and the table, what is the shortest time in minutes from point X to point Y? Here, the points A, B, and C may be passed through in any order.
Which of the following examples of capacity building and guidance for subordinates is classified as OJT?

options.text: A company made subordinates set career goals and make plans for achieving them.
With subordinates' careers in mind, a company made subordinates attend a manager development course hosted by the Personnel Department.
A company made subordinates take part in a new development project to improve their design capabilities.
A company selected an externally hosted seminar matched to subordinates' fields of expertise and careers, and made the subordinates attend it.

question.text: An implementation plan for a company-wide information system that is consistent with the business strategy is to be created. Which of the following is the most appropriate person to take responsibility for this activity?

options.text: Head of the core business department
Person in charge of planning in the information systems department

options.text: The code can contain only single-byte alphanumeric characters and symbols.

Among the lists of corporate activities A through D, which of the following is the list that contains all activities concerning the establishment of compliance? A: Supporting fine art and cultural activities B: Training employees in the codes of conduct C: Performing activities for prevention of global desertification D: Creating a mechanism for whistle blowing

Which of the following is an expected result of implementing simultaneous streamlining of production planning, production processes, and working methods through reduction in product types and a review of work details?

options.text: Labor saving and efficiency improvement is expected.

question.text: (Question text for Q79 missing in sources)
Which of the following is an appropriate attitude toward product purchase of a consumer called an opinion leader?

options.text: Conveying one’s evaluation of a product to friends and acquaintances after the product becomes popular
Taking into consideration their friends’ evaluation and public opinion when deciding whether to purchase a product
Waiting for the sales of a new product to start, and being eager to acquire it before friends and acquaintances
Purchasing a new product in its initial phase of sale, and conveying information about the product to friends and acquaintances

question.text: Which of the following is the appropriate combination of the techniques A through C that are used by a retail company which collects and utilizes information at the time of sale in order to restock appropriately and analyze strong-selling products? [Techniques: CRM, POS, SCM]
question.images: Implied table mapping business function to technique

question.text: A middle-sized electrical manufacturer company A divides the products into groups in accordance with their potential and competitive strength in order to determine the priority of investing funds among their lineup. Which of the following is the most appropriate method of analysis for this purpose?

options.text: Cluster analysis regarding the prices and the customer bases of the company’s products
RFM analysis regarding the customers that purchase the company’s products
PPM analysis regarding the shares and the market growth rates of the company’s products
Principle component analysis regarding the cause of faults in the company’s products

question.text: Which of the following is an appropriate explanation of a business model where a service or mechanism matches users and providers, and idle assets owned by individuals or companies are lent to others, or services are provided by the providers in their spare time?

options.text: It is a technique of analyzing and designing corporate activities from the viewpoint of what kind of value the in-house activities finally generate for customers and whether this satisfies the customers.
It is a technique of plotting a business on a matrix created by the two (2) quantitative values of market growth rate and market share, and then optimizing the allocation of resources.

question.text: Which of the following is the most appropriate method of analysis for determining the combination of manufacturing and selling products to maximize profits in a company that produces and sells many types of products?
Which of the following is the most appropriate explanation of a patent strategy of cross-licensing?

options.text: It is the acquisition of patents held by a company through absorption-style merger, to gain that company’s technology.
It is implementation of joint research with other organizations, to complement a company’s own technologies and apply for patents.
It is granting a company’s own patents to other companies and obtaining royalties commensurate with their value.
It is mutual consent between patent holders on the use of each other’s patents.

question.text: When the spreadsheet shown below is converted into CSV format, which of the following is an appropriate list of data that is generated by spreadsheet software? Here, records are separated by the carriage return code “CR”. The expression in a cell is automatically recalculated, and the resulting value is written back into that cell.

question.text: Which of the following is the situation where an improvement can be expected by installing a Material Requirements Planning (MRP) system?

options.text: Design drawings are managed on both electronic files and hard copies, so design change history cannot be accurately known.
Information concerning materials and their quantities required for manufacturing is complicated, so it is easy to miscalculate order quantities, and production is being adversely affected.
There are many design changes, so production efficiency does not improve.
High-mix, low-volume production is adopted, so the cost of installing production equipment is increasing.

question.text: Which of the following is a system that collects information that is required for sales management or inventory control by reading or keying in a product code or a buyer’s attribute at the time of a sale?
Among the characteristics required for an embedded system, which of the following is the most appropriate terminology used when a certain process must be completed within a given period of time?
Which of the following is an appropriate explanation of CAD, as used in the manufacturing industry?

options.text: It calculates the required quantity of materials for a product production plan and (missing text).
It refers to the use of computers in the design of buildings and industrial products.
It is an imaging element that converts light to an electrical signal.
It refers to the combination of characters, images, audio, and other data in order to create a single piece of content.

options.text: Shipment is not possible immediately when an order is received, but there is no risk of an excessive number of products in the inventory.
It is required to increase the accuracy of order forecast, and maintain the optimum inventory volume of products.

options.text: Knowledge of new PC products and each model’s performance
The ability to perceive the impacts of technological innovations on society
The ability to search for data necessary for business and use it in accordance with goals

question.text: Which of the following is a term that means that the development and operation of a software robot is conducted to achieve automation and improved efficiency by replacing humans with a software robot to perform routine office work?

question.images: Implied DFD diagram showing Reception referencing Guest list and Seating availability

Which of the following is an appropriate approver for the optimization plan of the overall information system of a company?

options.text: Head of the business operations department handling the mission-critical system

question.text: Company A runs a securities business and Company B is a system developer. Company A outsources a project to develop a stock ordering system to Company B from the start of the project. During the operational test of the project, a defect is discovered. The defect is caused because Company A did not inform Company B of the 'Exceptional rule for approval of the responsible person during ordering of stocks.' Which of the following is the phase where such a rule should be clearly explained to Company B?
